results.title: Appetite of a bird
results.brief_description: An animated conflict between man and a woman - the both being handformed from shape to shape. An interesting interpretation of male and female roles.

results.title: Apollo soyuz
results.creator_credit: Byron Morgan, David Gerber and Screen Presentation
results.brief_description: Describes the agreements and preparation for the 1975 Apollo Soyuz international space mission. The United States and the USSR May 1972 agreement for this joint mission in space includes standardization of docking procedures and equipment that will increase safety, provides for dual rescue missions, and opens up new opportunities for further research and discoveries. Narrated by Yul Brynner and Paul Picerni.

results.title: Apollo in Ascension
results.creator_credit: Michael Orrom and Gable and Wireless
results.brief_description: This is a documentary about the building of a satellite communication station on Ascension Island as part of the Apollo Project and the planned first spece flight to the moon.

results.title: Apollo 12: pinpoint for science
results.brief_description: The story of the flight of Apollo 12 and the second landing of men on the moon on November 19th 1969. Gives primary emphasis to the lunar exploration carried out by the crew; deployment of scientific equipment, retrieval of parts of a Surveyor space craft which landed on the moon in 1967, and the collection of rock and soil samples. No other credits available

results.title: Aorere: an attempt at change
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, New Zealand and Zero Sixteen Films
results.brief_description: The headmaster of Aorere College in South Auckland, New Zealand, believes that the resources of secondary schools should be used more completely. Shows the ways in which other members of the community share the facilities of Aorere College.

results.title: Anyplace but here
results.creator_credit: Maurice Murad, Tom Spain and C B S News
results.brief_description: Examines the dilemma facing the mentally ill in America and the people who try to help them. With the advent of stabilising drugs, more patients are returning to the community. However, unless the patients have homes to return to they are released into communities unprepared to either accept or treat them. Follows three patients on their separate paths as they seek their release from a psychiatric centre.

results.title: Any time, any place
results.brief_description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. While many humans still exist as they did centuries ago, modern man has built a wall against nature. Calls for teaching to inspire and regain an interest in nature. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Anti-matter
results.creator_credit: Carlos Gutierrez-Mena, Lewis C. Hall and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Physics
results.brief_description: This program explores the subject of anti-matter; its significance as a destructive process and the possibility of its constructive use. It explains matter, anti-matter and explores the possibility that large quantities of anti-matter exist in space.

results.title: Antarctica: the unowned land
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to Antarctica showing landforms, ice and animal life such as penguins and whales. Briefly touches on the impact of humans in the area. The program also spends some time studying the animal life in the Falkland Islands. No other credits available.
